attributes.action: Make petrol tax cheaper for sports car drivers
attributes.background: Because driving and running costs are already a lot. Petrol shouldn't be over priced so people can't drive how they want to drive Thierry performance cars

attributes.action: Create independent body to call re-elections if campaign promises are not kept
attributes.background:
Create an independent body to call snap elections/referendums, protecting our right to Democratic representation

Reverse the current trend of politicians basing campaigns on promises publicised to secure votes, then immediately discarded

Key promises must be identified+independently monitored
attributes.additional_details:
The Leave campaign's pre-vote promises: 
https://goo.gl/DuYSZg

4 key promises retracted in first 24 hours: https://goo.gl/i83HYK

9 key pre-election promises broken by Tory Gov't in 1st 100 days: http://goo.gl/ZkgEqa

More pre-election promises immediately discarded: http://goo.gl/H3pnZM

If we are unable to vote on issues we want represented then we do not live in a functioning democracy

Intentions should be clearly stated as separate from promises. Promises should include dates for review

attributes.action: Lower the voting age in referendums to 15 and elections to 16.
attributes.background: After the EU referendum I felt powerless to say my opinion because I am too young to vote. However many people at my school have a very large knowledge and definitely would've voted if they had the chance too. The people that these referendums impact the most aren't allowed to put forward their say.

attributes.action: Ensure the Brexit negotiating team is politically representative
attributes.background: The UK has just voted to leave the EU and after Article 50 is triggered we will have to negotiate the terms of our disengagement within two years. Our current government gained a parliamentary majority with just 37% of the vote. It does not have a mandate to carry out these negotiations on its own.
attributes.additional_details: Requirements of negotiation: The team negotiating our terms of our disengagement from the EU should consist of MPs from all parties. The final terms should only be considered passed if voted for by a super-majority (66%) in parliament. Each constituent nation's administration shall have a veto over the terms.

attributes.action: New government to reach an agreement on Free trade and Free movement with the EU
attributes.background:
The  EU  has been the UK's largest trade partner for years. It will be
devastating for our economy to not be able to enjoy free trade with
the  EU  as  a  whole, should the UK actually leave the EU in the near
future. Same goes for free movement of UK citizens in Europe
attributes.additional_details:
Now  that  the  UK  has  voted to leave the EU, I believe it is in the
common  interest  of  British people to have a comprehensive agreement with  the  EU  as  a  whole  rather than with each individual  country, agreement  that  would give us free trade and free movement, something we have so much enjoyed whilst being a part of the EU. EU has been our biggest  trade  partner (collectively) and will continue to be such in the future. This should become the #1 priority of the new UK government.

attributes.action: Block George Osborne's emergency budget proposal, if Britain leaves the EU
attributes.background: George Osborne has announced that if Britain leaves the EU, he will be forced to raise taxes and cut spending to prevent an economic meltdown. Not only is the 'evidence' used to suggest this just based on wild predictions and scaremongering, but it also contradicts the 2015 conservative manifesto.

attributes.action: Ensure the EU referendum goes ahead and we get our democratic right to decide.
attributes.background: I want to ensure the British people get their say on 23rd June as to whether we remain a part of the EU or not. A petition calling for the referendum to be cancelled and for the British government to make the decision (to stay in the EU) is circulating. Help ensure the democratic process happens.

attributes.action: Protect identities of those subject to unsubstantiated allegations of sex abuse
attributes.background:
Several big name celebrities have been accused of historic sex abuse  their identities released to the public domain before any of the unsubstantiated allegations have been investigated.
I want to see a change in the law that protects the identity of these persons until charged with any offences.

attributes.action: A law that restricts roadworks to 5 miles in any 30 mile stretch on a motorway.
attributes.background: Over the past few years there has been significant investment in upgrading our motorway system, this has resulted in many miles of roadworks with restricted road width and an imposed fifty mile an hour speed limited that is monitored. Some roadworks go on for 15 miles plus.
attributes.additional_details: Extended roadworks (greater than 5 miles, Incl lead-in/out) with reduced lanes and a 50 Mile an hour speed limit requires significant levels of concentration. It increases the likelihood of an accident, increases traffic jams, restricts movement, increases the time it takes to get from A to B when the roadworks are for extended miles. Drivers get more frustrated, more likely to speed. When there is a 15 mile stretch of roadworks, on large stretches nobody is working anyway!

attributes.action: A review of the British High Comission Visa Department in Pakistan.
attributes.background: The British High Comission has been rejecting thousands of UK Visa applicants from Pakistan in a unsophisticated way. So I plead to the British Government to review the ongoing in Pakistan's visa department, as rate of rejection is currently higher than ever, and this is not humanly right.
attributes.additional_details: Currently, the British High Commission charges fees from Rs14,000 to Rs100,000 for visas of different categories and durations. In some cases Pakistanis have submitted a number of a applications to the BHC for visas, and paid the fee a number of times, only to be turned down without a justifiable reason. This could be in fear of terrorism, which is understandable at the current time, however this does not highlight why thousands of applicants are being tuned down without a justified reason.

attributes.action: Provide 'Be a Tree' training to children in schools.
attributes.background: I would like to see training provided to children in schools as to how to behave around dogs, in particular, the method of 'Be a Tree'.  The rationale behind this is in order to help prevent dog bites as a number of parents/adults are not aware of the behaviours that can lead to them.
attributes.additional_details: Dogs are stimulated by noise and movement. Unfortunately most children will be running around making a noise when they meet dogs. There are many kits already available, specifically aimed at teachers, such as http://www.clickertraining.com/node/3535 or http://www.be-a-tree.com/. It would be very easy for the Government to develop something similar for use in schools and is an easy way to educate everyone, as I'm sure children could be encouraged to impart what they have learned to their family.

attributes.action: Make 'motorway driving' lessons a mandatory part of the driving license test
attributes.background: The current driving license has no complete section on motorway driving and only includes them within 'Pass Plus'. Motorway driving and motorway etiquette are an invaluable part of driving as a whole and it should be mandatory for motorway lessons for drivers.
attributes.additional_details: The number of large scale roads are increasing dramatically in the UK and with no real lessons or real time motorway education, new drivers enter motorways, sometimes without driving on them ever before. The rules of motorway driving need to be taught to all new drivers. Motorways are a very dangerous place and it is unfair to send a new driver out onto one without them having any previous motorway lessons.

attributes.action: Allow Gamaniel Josh Pensee to remain in the UK following notice of deportation
attributes.background: Gamaniel Josh Pensee is an accomplished amateur boxer who is due to be deported to his country of birth, he has no ties or means of living. Living in the UK since a child and boxing throughout, he is set to turn pro. The popular and friendly character inspires all, he is expecting his first child
attributes.additional_details: Gamaniel Josh Pensee is a 27 and soon to be father. He came to England with his mother aged 14 and believed he had permission to live here after his mother was granted indefinite leave to remain whilst he was still a child. It wasn’t until he tried to apply to University in his 20’s that he was made aware that his mother’s status had not automatically applied to him. After appointing a lawyer and adhering to bail conditions whilst he has sought to be granted the same status as his mother, he was suddenly detained on 13th April 2016. He was soon after issued with a notice of intention for his deportation

attributes.action: make all care/rest homes have a percentage of locally funded beds
attributes.background: Why should the elderly have to lose all their money, sell their property to pay for their care when they have to go into a care/residential home? Then when the money runs out, they have to move on?
attributes.additional_details: Care homes/Residential homes charge an extorionate rate for the care they provide, ranging from £800 to £1000+ per week. Some places are locally funded, whilst others are privately funded, meaning the person living there has to pay full price, for the care they receive. Locally funded places, will take into account someones pension, and will only pay some of the cost,leaving the person very little "pocket money". But atleast they have some money! All care homes/Residential homes, should allow for the fact that someones money will run out eventually and should make provisions for this, allowing the elderly person to go over to locally funded monies, without moving them on,so the elderly person, will be secure in the place they live, to live outtheir final days.

attributes.action: Provide New Zealand with aid to help them rebuild after the earthquake.
attributes.background: In light of the two earthquakes that have just hit the New Zealand south island on 13th Nov, the British Government should provide aid to assist the government and people of New Zealand to rebuild their infrastructure. The money should come from the overseas aid budget

attributes.action: Create an age and licence type restriction for drivers of more powerful cars
attributes.background: Young bikers are restricted as to how powerful a bike they can ride based on their age & licence type, yet car drivers can drive any car at any age once they've passed a manual test. This leaves fast cars in the hands of people who aren't competent to drive them, and is also unfair to bikers.
attributes.additional_details: Government statistics from 2011 show that 22% of road fatalities in that year involved drivers aged 17-24. A motorcycle-style age and licence grading system needs to be enforced to reduce these figures.

attributes.action: Clearly define to Donald Trump what behaviour would end our special relationship
attributes.background: We the undersigned demand a debate in parliament to clearly define, both to the UK and US governments, what behaviour by the new US President-elect in office would result in the British people demanding the end of the UK-US special relationship.
attributes.additional_details: The UK-US special relationship has been built on shared values, objectives & defence over many years. We the undersigned want the special relationship to continue but it can only be special if those values, objectives & defence are still shared. Donald Trump has been democratically elected president of the US, having made remarks during his campaign that many in the UK do not agree with. It is not our place to interfere with who is US president, but we can decide how we respond to the choice.

attributes.action: Ensure Gender Inequality is taught as part of secondary school curriculum.
attributes.background: Our aim is to spread awareness of the impact in which these subtle but meaningful gender stereotypes impact on women, men and children in society unwittingly. Promote high self esteem as well as to recognize the impact these portrayals have on different people.

attributes.action: Create specialist knife crime units within the police.
attributes.background: In areas that have high levels of knife crime. Specialist knife crime units need to be created within the police, to tackle this ongoing issue.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.birminghammail.co.uk/news/midlands-news/black-october-knife-crime-after-12086384.amp

attributes.action: Stop the Heathrow Airport expansion
attributes.background: The UK government decided to build another runway at Heathrow Airport. This topic has been up for debate for many months & out of the 2 largest airports (Heathrow & Gatwick), the UK Government felt that another runway should be added to Heathrow. Since the news broke out, social media has received
attributes.additional_details: thousands of people expressing their concern on the #HeathrowExpansion, stating that this should have gone to Gatwck . Heathrow itself, is already a mega sized airport & as a local resident, I can tell you how bad it can be with the noise & the releasing of jet fuel on the local resident houses & the other problem is that, they are promising jobs, but what about job loses! All it takes is another major attack, & people will not fly as much, which will lead to pressure on airlines & job losses.

attributes.action: Allow the continued use of A2 motorcycle restrictor kits.
attributes.background: The plan to prohibit current use of A2 restrictor kit seems unfair to a lot of riders as this is a step up for their current A1 licence restricting the to 125cc motorcycles. The UK is one of the strictest if not the strictest when it comes to motorcycle laws,this is a step in the wrong direction.

attributes.action: Reduce TV License Fee for full time students living away from home.
attributes.background: Recent introduction of full TV license for students living away from home, even for iPlayer is nonsensical as it will be ignored, not paid and cannot be policed.  A more pragmatic approach would be to have a nominal fee (eg £10) where students can provide parental details of cover at home address.

attributes.action: Parliament must vote on initial aims of Brexit and then trigger Article 50.
attributes.background: The country voted 52:48 to leave the EU in June and to make Parliament sovereign in the UK. To be sovereign, Parliament must therefore be able to vote on and scrutinise the initial aims for Brexit negotiations and then vote to ensure article 50 is triggered, not leaving it to royal prerogative.
attributes.additional_details: In determining the starting point of Brexit, our elected representatives must have the chance to properly scrutinise and vote on the aims of the negotiations. MPs must engage with their constituents and all stakeholders to represent us, the people, in determining what the aims of Brexit should be. Our elected MPs should then vote to ensure article 50 is triggered so negotiations start following these aims set out by Parliament. To be truly sovereign, Parliament must play its full role in Brexit.

attributes.action: As with perjury, hold politicians in contempt of the realm if they lie publicly.
attributes.background:
Perjury: the offence of wilfully telling an untruth or making a misrepresentation under oath.
If you lie in court you can be sentenced to a term of imprisonment of up to 7 years. 
If you are a politician however, who lies under oath religiously to the public, then you usually receive a promotion.
attributes.additional_details:
We have recently seen the effect of such lies told to the country, yet those responsible for their gross misrepresentations continue to enjoy their profession having never been held legally accountable for the horrendous damage caused by their deceitful rhetoric. 

Make lying to the public, whilst in office, the same offence as lying in court.

attributes.action: Scrap the BBC Television Licence.
attributes.background: The BBC licence fee is a unlawful tax against watching television. The BBC should not dictate our ability to watch television such as ITV and Channel 4.

attributes.action: Raise the UK speed limit on Motorways and major a roads to 85
attributes.background: Will help with the flow of traffic on major A roads and motorways
attributes.additional_details: Most people already speed on motorways and major A roads and everybody know so  it so instead make it legal instead of illegal.

attributes.action: Make child benefit rules fairer
attributes.background: Currently couples with one partner earning over 60 thousand pounds annually are not entitled to any child benefit. If however both parents are working and they earn over 60 thousand pounds combined but with both individully earning less than that amount, they are entitled to this benefit.
attributes.additional_details: A couple may earn 55 thousand pounds each and get child benefit however if one person earns 60 thousand they do not.

attributes.action: Stop the Government ripoff on car road tax transfer return to old system
attributes.background: when a car is sold in the middle of the month the owner losses two weeks road tax refund and the new owner has to pay from the beginning of the month  paying for two weeks he/she has not had,so the GOV.is stealing four weeks road tax, return to the old system where the road tax can stay with the car

attributes.action: Make the use of parent and child parking spaces in car parks badge holders only!
attributes.background: When parking with young children in car parks extra door space is needed. Most car parks provide this facility but unfortunately some people don't think they need to have children in the car to use these spaces. I think the introduction of a badge system to use these spaces is needed to stop this.
attributes.additional_details: Every time I use or try to use these spaces that are provided for parents with children I see others use them with no children in the car. I think that this lack of consideration is very infuriating and every parent I have spoken to agrees. At one time or another I'm sure like me you have struggled to get your children out of a small space because maybe that last space had been taken by someone who didn't actually need it. If you agree with me please sign this petition

attributes.action: Make it law that all bus companies must have space for 2 wheelchairs and a Pram
attributes.background:
Were asking that we catch up with mainland europe when it comes to disability access especially on transport such as buses who currently only allow one wheelchair and a pram.

Disabled people travel together and to expect them to catch separate buses so they can go out together is disgraceful!
attributes.additional_details:
Its time we caught up with mainland europes public transport giving a minimum of 2 priority wheelchair spaces on each bus and a space for 1 or 2 prams.

Wheelchair users find it hard to use public transport but if your a wheelchair user with another friend whos a wheelchair user you find it impossible to go out together as you have to take separate buses some which could be an hour apart.

Its time the companies providing the service were made to make this a requirement making it fairer for all

attributes.action: Allow MOD personnel to cook meals within SLA using issued or personal appliances
attributes.background: Safety regulations have resulted in the banning of any cooking appliances other than microwave and toaster within SLA. This makes PAYD the only option on camps for eating a hot meal, allowing for monopoly by contractors. Personnel should be allowed the option of cooking their own meals if they wish.

attributes.action: Reduce the working day to 6 hours with the same salary.
attributes.background:
Companies in Sweden have reduced the working hours of their employees to six hours, reporting happier staff, a lower turnover rate, and an increase in profits in that time.

Who doesn't want to spend more time with their friends and family, whilst also being more motivated and productive at work?
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/sweden-introduces-six-hour-work-day-a6674646.html

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/business/the-six-hour-work-day-increases-productivity-so-will-britain-and-america-adopt-one-sweden-a7066961.html

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-34677949

attributes.action: Drug test all ministers and senior civil servants including the military
attributes.background: Rig workers are tested to avoid destroying the North Sea in fact lots of employers demand a pre employment tests. Our representatives are running the country and far too many senior politicians behave and look like they are on much more than fairy dust .We deserve the best.

attributes.action: Reduce the full time working week to 35 hours, without lowering current salary.
attributes.background:
The UK Government needs to tackle the long-hours culture & promote a restructuring of working time (max 35 hours per week) and the way in which people work such as flexible working.

People who work more than 48 hours per week report more problems in terms of work & health than those who do not.
attributes.additional_details:
According to the 2011 Workplace Employment Relations Study (WERS), 41% of employees agreed or strongly agreed with the statement: ‘People in this workplace who want to progress usually have to put in long hours.’ 

According to the Fifth European Working Conditions Survey, people who work more than 48 hours per week report more problems in terms of work and health than those who do not.

attributes.action: Restrict drivers aged 17-22 to cars limited to 40mph and 0-60mph 15 secs
attributes.background: It is common to see young drivers driving badly, too fast, aggressively,  and involved in accidents that cause death and injury to themselves and others. I believe it would be a relatively easy step to restrict the power and speed of cars driven by young drivers.
attributes.additional_details: It would require car manufacturers to create a new range of restricted, but affordable cars, that would also lead to cheaper insurance for first time drivers.

attributes.action: Ban junk food and fizzy drinks companies from advertising
attributes.background:
There is no arguing that marketing companies make an impact. Food and drinks companies have some of the best marketing in the world. 

If we can eliminate advertising of fizzy drinks and junk food, we can work to really reduce the obesity epidemic which the western world is in the grip of.
attributes.additional_details:
There was a time where Santa's suit was Green, Red or Tan depending on the person drawing it, then Coca Cola came along and used Santa as part of their Christmas marketing drive and since then we've all come to know the jolly fat man in the red suit.

Advertising is extremely powerful and has a huge influence on the purchasing decisions of our nation. A ban on these companies would very likely decrease the sales of unhealthy goods in this country and help to decrease the obesity epidemic.

attributes.action: Stop Sexual Harrassment in Schools
attributes.background:
A 2010 YouGov poll of 16-18 year olds found 29% of girls experienced unwanted sexual touching at school and a further 71% said they heard sexual name-calling towards girls at school daily or a few times per week.
We want it to be made law for schools to train teachers on how to prevent this.
attributes.additional_details:
Data published in September 2015 showed that 5,500 sexual offences were recorded in UK schools over a three year period, including 600 rapes. 
In 2015 Girlguiding UK found 90% of young women aged 13-21 agree that the government should make sure all schools are addressing sexual harassment and bullying in schools.

attributes.action: Remove the Insurance Premium Tax
attributes.background: A tax known as IPT (Insurance Premium Tax) was added to all insurance policies by the last government and was originally levied at 6%. Recently this has risen to 9% and due to become 10% in October 2016.
attributes.additional_details: On a £500 insurance policy this adds a tax (for the privilege of taking out a policy, be it house insurance, car insurance, holiday insurance and pet insurance) of £50 to your Policy  and pro rata according to the amount you pay for your Policy. This is a statutory amount payable on EVERY policy you take out and so you are paying this tax on every Policy you have. You are not paying once, but a number of times. The IPT compulsory charge is making insurance policies unaffordable and is yet another `hidden` tax which is making us all poorer. Please sign the Petition to have IPT removed.

attributes.action: Get British troops out of Iraq and Syria and stop all air strikes now
attributes.background: The presence of British troops in Syria and Iraq and the bombing and killing of innocent people including children is beyond wrong this war that's already been shown to be fake, no weapons of mass destruction were ever found so why does it carry on?!
attributes.additional_details: The fight to have Tony Blair held accountable for his actions over the war in Iraq speaks for itself and you only need to watch the news and see poor babies and children being pulled from rubble that was once their local hospital, library, school or home. So many leave their homes and don't ever return it's so wrong and we shouldn't stand by and let it happen any longer, the world will be one by peace love and cooperation not hate fighting and war. We can stop it together

attributes.action: Limit maximum private parking charges.
attributes.background: This petition is to get a law in place to limit the maximum fine private parking companies can charge to £60 and a minimum of a 50% discount if paid within 14 days.

attributes.action: The Abolition of the Monarchy to be in effect as soon as possible
attributes.background:
We the undersigned, want to abolish the Monarchy due to many reasons.

Mainly due to them being out of touch with the majority of the public in the 21st Century, their unaccountability and constantly showing us how unequal we are in this country we call a democracy.
attributes.additional_details:
The Monarchy still retains a lot of political power for an establishment that is unelected, being able to influence our laws on a daily basis, this is well known.
The Monarch retains the powers to appoint and dismiss Prime Ministers that we elect by a democratic majority whenever they choose, the last time this happened was in 1974.
Officially, we are subjects and not citizens of this country from the day we are born.
Also, we spend far too much on the Monarchy, this money could be spent better.

attributes.action: Make inheritance tax applicable to all estates without exception.
attributes.background: It appears very rich people can avoid paying inheritance tax by using tax avoidance measures such as trusts. It would be fair if tax laws were simple and applied to everyone. If it is the law that inheritance tax is paid on estates above a certain value it must apply to everyone without exception.

attributes.action: Change the 40 year rolling exemption for classic vehicles to 30 year.
attributes.background: I feel that the standard should be revised from 40 years to 30 years. Many cars over 25 years now are classic cars and are on classic car policys which do little mileage per year. Cars over 20 years are rarely seen on the road on a daily basis so I think the above should be revised.
attributes.additional_details: My vehicle is a classic car and is 26 years old. It is on classic car insurance as there are only 30 of my vehicle on the road and is classed as a classic vehicle by my insurer so why shouldn't I get historic car status in 4 years time.

attributes.action: Stop cutting child benefits for families struggling in the uk
attributes.background: From April 2016 the income threshold was cut from £6,420 to £3,850 meaning fewer people are eligible to claim child benefits, for families with over two children in the UK this means that they will not get benefits for the 3rd+ child.

attributes.action: Make GCSE Food Technology compulsory
attributes.background: Im a food lover and blogger and I want to make a change. I have loved food ever since I watched a Jamie Oliver christmas special back in 2006. My love for food and specifically helping younger people have grown over the years and now I want to kick up a fuss and make GCSE Food Technology compulsory
attributes.additional_details: The number of children taking Food Technology at GCSE is dropping. Too many kids nowadays are growing up not knowing how about food, with around 2 million children growing up with just one parent-it is questionable that mums and dads just don't have the time to teach their children how to cook/bake. The Department of Education quite clearly is TOO focused on wanting the children of the future to grow up to become more academic.

attributes.action: Restore the Imperial system of measurment to the UK and phase out Metrication.
attributes.background: Metrication was forced upon the UK as a result of joining the so called EEC with those that resisted being prosecuted. Now that we are about to become a sovereign nation again and resume trade with many commonwealth and former colonies we need to return to what is a superior standard of measurement.

attributes.action: Relax the rules on appearance to allow service personnel to blend in more.
attributes.background: After recent attempted kidnapping of a serviceman I think it's time that the rules governing appearance and grooming should be permanently relaxed to allow serviceman appear to be a member of public.

attributes.action: Incentivise businesses to increase the number of Standing Desks for employees
attributes.background: Employees spend 40+ hours a week at their desks, the lack of movement is a key problem in the obesity pandemic. Introducing standing desks DRAMATICALLY reduces this and the chances of type II diabetes. Getting businesses to bring in standing desks will help make Britain healthier. We need guidelines
attributes.additional_details:
Some of the benefits of standing desks have been ratified by research conducted in the States and in Britain. According to the researchers 'Sitting is the new smoking'. 

Below are some articles which list the benefits:

http://www.smithsonianmag.com/science-nature/five-health-benefits-standing-desks-180950259/?no-ist
https://authoritynutrition.com/7-benefits-of-a-standing-desk

attributes.action: Invest more funds into research, management & recovery of CFS/ME Chronic Fatigue
attributes.background: After being diagnosed with CFS/ME Chronic Fatigue Syndrome in 2013, I've struggled to get any ongoing support for my symptoms, management and recovery. There's simply not enough understood about the condition within the NHS or the general public. More research and media exposion is urgently needed!
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.meassociation.org.uk

http://www.meassociation.org.uk/how-you-can-help/introduction-to-our-cbt-get-and-pacing-report/

http://www.meassociation.org.uk/research2015/cfsme-research-collaborative/

https://www.actionforme.org.uk

https://www.nice.org.uk/guidance/cg53

https://www.nice.org.uk/guidance/cg53/ifp/chapter/Managing-CFSME

https://www.nice.org.uk/guidance/cg53/evidence/full-guideline-196524109

attributes.action: To force all large retail outlets to buy British produce first at a fair price
attributes.background: With more and more produce available in the UK, why do we need to import 100's of tons of fruit and veg. I don't mind buying wonky carrots or odd shape veg, as long as it supports our farming/fishing industry. We need to support our own producers first.
